instructions: Mix up your marinade ingredients in a bowl 🥣:
⅓ cup olive oil 🫒
A generous splash of soy sauce 🧂
A dash or two of Worcestershire sauce
Juice of ½ lemon 🍋
1-2 grated garlic cloves 🧄
Salt and pepper to taste
Give it a little taste test 😋—tweak it if you need to.
Drop your steak in 🥩, cover it up, and let it soak up all that flavorful goodness.
If you’re waiting more than 2 hours, pop it in the fridge for a flavor spa day. 🕒
Thinly slice two white onions 🧅—because these babies are about to get sweet and golden.
Heat 2 tbsp butter 🧈 in a pan over medium heat. Add your onions and a pinch of salt.
Cover and let them cook slowly while you stir occasionally—like giving them little love pats. 🥄
After about 45 minutes ⏳, add a splash of red wine 🍷 to deglaze.
Cook until they’re soft, golden, and oh-so-sweet.
Combine these ingredients in a bowl 🥣:
½ cup mayonnaise 🥪
1 tbsp lemon juice 🍋
1 grated garlic clove 🧄
Salt and pepper to taste
Stir and taste as you go 👅. Make it as garlicky or tangy as your heart desires. 💖
Heat up a cast-iron skillet to medium-high 🔥—it’s time to sizzle!
Sear the steak 🥩 for 3-4 minutes on each side until it’s beautifully crusted.
Let it rest for 5 minutes 🕒 because patience = juicy steak.
Slice it thinly against the grain for maximum tenderness. 🔪
Grab your baguette 🥖 and slice it in half lengthwise—show off those knife skills!
On one side, spread a layer of garlic aioli 🧄.
Layer on the sliced steak 🥩 and provolone cheese 🧀. Broil it in the oven for a few minutes until the cheese is melted and gooey. 🔥
Top it off with caramelized onions 🧅.
On the other half of the baguette, spread more aioli and add a handful of arugula tossed in olive oil and lemon juice. 🥗
Put the sandwich together, slice into portions, and take a BIG bite.
Warning: it’s juicy, cheesy, and downright irresistible. 😍 Stay hongry, babe! 🍴
